page.title: 07Lyddington Church today.
page.content: Although in the 1980's the church does not hold the central position in the life of the villagers as it did in former times,it is still looked after and loved by many.Less than a third of the population attend services regularly,but more at Christmas and Harvest Festivals.The fabric of the building is well kept,recently the roof has been repaired,new tarmac laid on all the paths around the church and the churchyard in general kept neat and tidy.Inside there are new embroidered kneelers,new curtains, carpets and linen for the Communion Table.The Altar is quite unique,being completely surrounded by the altar rails on all four sides and dated 1635 There are 6 bells, which are rung most Sundays.The lighting has been renewed, all this enhancing an already beautiful interior.
